intro: Impatiens debilis, commonly known as the weak impatiens, is a delicate flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender stems, heart-shaped leaves, and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. It is a member of the Balsaminaceae family, which includes other popular garden plants like touch-me-nots. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is occasionally grown in gardens and greenhouses.
